channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2024072457
item.description:
Report X-2024072457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE, HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND SECONDARY CONTAINMENT CONSISTED OF A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DMP WAS CALLED FOR LEAKER ON ORANGE BELT. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO SPILL AND SAW IT WAS A FLAMMABLE LIQUID. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET AND PUT ON PROPER PPE. CLEANED SPILL AND TRANSPORTED PKG BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MCIR location a plastic bucket was found with an odor. While investigating the shipment the agent observed a 5.1 DG label under the layers of plastic wrap. There was no DG paperwork accompanying the shipment. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024070643
item.description:
Report E-2024070643

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: JOPLIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was doing pre trip and noticed a couple drips coming from trailer at approximately 0830 ct. Drive put down some absorbent then called the company's emergency number. The team was dispatched to the location arriving around 1100ct. They began unloading the trailer and found a 55 gallon drum with a pinhole in it. The drum did not look damaged other than the pin hole. The team then put the drum into a salvage drume and the material was cleaned up with absorbent and the disposed of in the appropriate manor. The clean up was completed by 1400ct. There was approximately 1 cup released on the floor of the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2024072084
item.description:
Report X-2024072084

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-29T09:15:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 20:45 THE SUPERVISOR FROM THE PD 11 CALLED THE DMP CAGE TO INFORM THAT THERE WAS A LEAKING HAZMAT IN DOOR 112. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DONNING PROPER PPE ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UPON ENTERING THE TRAILER THEY DISCOVERED A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE LYING ON ITS SIDE. AFTER REFERRING TO THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THEY ACTED ACCORDINGLY. THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON OPENING THE SINGLEWALL FIBREBOARD BOX IT WAS DETERMINED THE CAUSE OF THE LEAKAGE WAS A LOOSE CAP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN DISPOSED OF ACCORDING TO THE DMP FLOW CHART AND PROPER APPENDIX.
